metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5180 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the ares_create_query function in c-ares 1.x before 1.12.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) or possibly execute arbitrary code via a hostname with an escaped trailing dot.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5180` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libc-ares2 - 1.10.0-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: c-ares package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.0-2ubuntu0.1').
